chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Rhonda R Jacquinot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Rhonda R Jacquinot
Current: 10431 S Florida Ave, Hayward, WI 54843 United States  (Effective: 09-23-2014)

Defendant Rhonda R Jacquinot in court via video means with Attorney Curtiss Norman Lein.  Defendant Rhonda R Jacquinot in custody.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  DE waived preliminary hearing time limits.  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Random Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
NO CONTACT with Paul Heidbreder

***COMBINED BOND WITH 14CF114***

***COMBINED BOND WITH 14CF114***

Bruce Poquette appeared in court.  DE appeared via video means, in custody.  Attorney Curtiss Lein appeared in person, on behalf of DE. 

Court set cash bond of $1,000.00 (COMBINED BOND WITH 14CF114), with conditions:

SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Random Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.

NO CONTACT with Paul Heidbreder.

DE may not possess any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

***COMBINED BOND WITH 14CF114***
